org.cast.cwm.glossary
Class GlossaryTransformer

java.lang.Object
  org.cast.cwm.glossary.GlossaryTransformer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, IDOMTransformer
public class GlossaryTransformer
extends Object
implements IDOMTransformer, Serializable

Takes an XML node and replaces in-text glossary words with 'glossary' nodes. Each glossary word is replaced by a <gl> element in the document's namespace. The element will have an "entry" attribute that contains the name of the actual glossary word. The content inside the glossary element will remain the same.

For example, if "gas" is a glossary word that is associated with "gaseous", the following would take place: 

 Original Node: The gaseous cloud.
 New Node: The <gl entry="gas">gaseous</gl> cloud.
These can then be replaced during XSLT transform with appropriate links to the glossary page.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

glosswordCheckElements

protected final List<String> glosswordCheckElements
A list of elements that *should* be checked for glossary words.

glosswordBlockingElements

protected final List<String> glosswordBlockingElements
A list of elements that will *not* be checked for glossary words. Child elements of these elements will not be checked.

glosswordBlockingClasses

protected final List<String> glosswordBlockingClasses
A list of classes that will *not* be checked for glossary words.

glosswordLinkButNotRecordElements

protected final List<String> glosswordLinkButNotRecordElements
Any element with this class attribute will be linked to the glossary but will not be remembered as having been linked already. As such, a glossary word could appear more than once on a given page if the first occurrence happens in a section with this class attribute.

glossary

protected Glossary glossary
Underlying Glossary object, if any.

glossaryMap

protected Map<String,String> glossaryMap
A map of all glossary word variations to actual glossary words.

usedEntryIds

protected Set<String> usedEntryIds
A list of glossary words that have already been linked in this section.

Constructor Detail

GlossaryTransformer

protected GlossaryTransformer()
Empty Constructor. This is used by subclassses that do not use a Glossary object. In such cases, the subclasses should override applyTransform(Element, TransformParameters) to set the glossaryMap before execution and getLastModified(TransformParameters).

getLastModified

public org.apache.wicket.util.time.Time getLastModified(TransformParameters params)
This method returns the last modified time of the underlying Glossary object. Implementations that do not use a Glossary object must override this to provide an accurate time.

Specified by:
getLastModified in interface IDOMTransformer
Parameters:
params - this can be null
Returns:

glosswordsToLinks

protected void glosswordsToLinks(Node n)
Recursively walk through page document and determine which text nodes are in paragraphs. Pass paragraph text nodes to routine that creates glossary word links.

replaceGlossWords

protected void replaceGlossWords(Node parent,
                                 Text origTextNode)
Search paragraph for glossary words. Change first occurrence of group of words belonging to same entryId (main word and alternates) to link to glossary page. After word is found, the word and all alternates are not longer linked later in the page.

createGlossaryElement

protected Element createGlossaryElement(Document doc,
                                        String entryId,
                                        String content)
Create and return a glossary link This will be an element whose local name is "gl" and whose namespace is the same as the namespace of the top-level element in the document.

Parameters:
doc - Document in which link is to be created
entryId - id of glossary element, used in attribute
content - text string content of element
Returns:
